sub_title: Futurist | Innovator | Complexity Scientist | Leadership & Organizations Specialist| Learning & Development Professional  | Consultant | Public Speaker | Co-Founder Synergized Earth Network (SEN)
summary: Dr. Seren Dalkiran is a versatile innovator, futurist and complexity scientist and leadership and organizations specialist with a focus on exploring new paradigms to contribute to human progress. She is developing social technology-innovations that aid in preserving the human aspect alongside heightened technological advancement in the digital age. She conducted award-winning (Emerald & HETL Outstanding Doctoral Research Award 2020 in Leadership and Organization Development) cutting-edge scientific research on Millennial leadership and the future of work in 117 countries worldwide as her doctoral research at the University of Notre Dame Australia, Utrecht University & Varna University of Management and the support of Professor emeritus Geert Hofstede. In the search for an alternative leadership and organizational paradigms to tackle pressing complex global challenges in the 21st century, she brings together theory and practice as well as science and society by also being the originator and co-founder of Synergized Earth Network (SEN) and founder of the Millennial Leadership lab (MLL). SEN is a global value-driven network uniting leaders across generations to tackle the most pressing challenges of our time. With the Millennial Leadership Lab (MLL) she consults (Fortune 500) companies and organizations on preparing for the future of education and work in the digital age. She also designs and organizes leadership and talent development programs, summits and retreats as a curriculum developer, trainer and coach. She is a futurist and Emerging Fellow at the Association of Professional Futurists (APF), a RSA Fellow, a Member of the Dutch Node of the Millennium Project, a Futurist & Complex Systems Advisory Board Member at the Lifeboat Foundation and an active member in shaping the Futures & Foresight Pod at Neol. As a bridge-builder across generations, disciplines she connects her diverse roles. In her work she constantly focuses on creating conducive conditions in which she and others can realize their purpose and full potential to align their personal and professional development and make meaningful impact within their communities, societies and the world at large. In her dedication to make a difference in both the Dutch society as well as the global community she won numerous (inter)national awards for academic excellence, leadership development and societal engagement. Seren is passionate to keep joining forces with emerging and existing (seasoned) leaders across generations to build a more just, thriving and sustainable world.

treasury_media.title: Profile Dr. Seren Dalkiran, Lifeboat Foundation's Futurist, Complex Systems and Sustainability Board
treasury_media.description: Seren Dalkiran, Ph.D. is a versatile futurist, innovator, complexity scientist, (leadership) educator, and consultant. She is the originator and co-founder of the Synergized Earth Network (SEN) and founder of the Millennial Leadership Lab (MLL). Seren s driving 21st-century cutting-edge leadership innovation and organizational development to prepare the next generations of leaders, professionals and organizations for the future and enhance human societies sustainably forward in the digital age.

projects.title: SENSummit2013
projects.description:
Global Intergenerational SENSummit2013 is a global gathering to strengthen the cohesion between young and old (emerging) leaders worldwide to work towards a better today and tomorrow. 

SENSummit2013 took place in the sustainable conference hotel, Kontakt de Kontinenten in Soesterberg in The Netherlands from 9-13 December 2013.

projects.title: Synergized Earth Network (SEN)
projects.description:
Synergized Earth Network (SEN) is a global value-driven intergenerational network of networks synergizing aligned capacities for social and sustainable change. SEN encourages shared-value collaborations in all segments of society on a local, national, regional and global level. 

To enable this we focus on awareness-building, self-empowerment processes and generating possible solutions under a shared vision and value-driven approach by driving innovation in (thought) leadership and impact based on ‘self-identified’ community needs. SEN organzies value-based leadership programs, retreats and summits and encompasses a growing world community and network of emerging youth leaders and seasoned leaders sector-wide working towards a more just, thriving and sustainable world in the 21st century. 

For more information: www.synergizedearthnetwork.org

authors.headline: Futurist | Innovator | Complexity Scientist | Leadership & Organizations Specialist| Learning & Development Professional  | Consultant | Public Speaker | Co-Founder Synergized Earth Network (SEN)

profile_positions.description:
Synergized Earth Network (SEN) is a global value-driven intergenerational network of networks that brings together leaders across generations to tackle the most pressing challenges of our time across generations, disciplines, and sectors. SEN collectivizes and synergizes aligned capacities for social and sustainable change in all segments of society on a local, national, regional, and global level. Its focus is on awareness-building, leadership development, lifelong learning, and personal and talent-development processes with a self-organizing approach. SEN convenes community, enhances capacity-building, develops science-based and practice-based knowledge and social-technology innovations to generate solutions based on self-identified community needs. SEN organizes value-based leadership programs, retreats, and summits and encompasses a growing world community and network of emerging values-based youth leaders and seasoned leaders working towards a more just, thriving, and sustainable world. 

For more information: www.synergizedearthnetwork.org
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & Originator

profile_positions.description: Millennial Leadership Lab (MLL) is a data-driven knowledge platform for and around Millennials focussing on equipping the next generation of leadership & preparing the future workforce in the digital age offering a variety of services to (Fortune 500) companies and organizations – from (customized) evidence-based leadership training, coaching, consultancy to public speaking services in order to help corporations, organizations and knowledge institutions to engage their internal and external Millennial workforce better.  In collaboration with the Centre for Innovation (CFI), the Faculty of Social & Behavioural Sciences at Leiden University and HUBspot Leiden, the Skills Academy: Maximize Your Potential! is an accredited elective and good practise established in higher education. In the Skills Academy experimenting with new forms of learning (21st century & transferable skills) and leadership in higher education is key to support students in aligning their personal and professional goals to clarify their career direction and prepare for the workforce of the future in the digital age.
profile_positions.title: Founder Millennial Leadership Lab (MLL)

profile_positions.description:
Millennial Motion: The Next Generation of Leadership is a platform launched in collaboration with the Millennial Research Team, Synergized Earth Network (SEN), Centre for Innovation, HagueTalks, OYWTheHague and in support of ImpactCity - The Hague Innovators, (ImpactEconomy, City of The Hague - Municipality). This platform brings together an intergenerational world community of NextGen leaders, change agents, (future) decision-makers, innovators, futurists, foresight practitioners, (social) entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs, scientists, educators, stakeholders, elders and mutual mentors. This is platform addresses Millennial leadership to address the importance of the role of NextGen leaders in global change processes and generate possible solutions across various impact areas. In this way, it builds an evidence-based bridge between theory and practise and the nexus between science and society.

NextGen Talks 
To provide NextGen leaders with this platform to voice their perspectives and a call to action, the NextGen Talks are organised. The story of a new generation of NextGen leaders who are emerging worldwide are addressed in these talks. NextGen leaders worldwide represent valuable voices and perspective across various impact areas covering civil society, business, governance, education, technology and grassroots leadership. Intergenerational and multi-stakeholder dialogue and cooperation is fostered by responses from stakeholders, elders and mutual mentors across different sectors. The NextGen Talks focus on understanding the new generation of leaders and the leadership they find necessary in order to equip themselves to become resilient in the face of global challenges. Since its launch, the NextGen Talks has been organized in The Hague, Bombay, Sydney, Istanbul, Devon and Dubai in collaboration with various stakeholders across the public and private sector.

For more information: www.millennialmotion.net
profile_positions.title: Initiator Millennial Motion: The Next Generation of Leadership

profile_positions.description:
Emerging Fellow and an official member of the Association of Professional Futurists (APF).
Emerging Fellowships are awarded to some of the most promising new futurists worldwide in order to give them a platform for cultivating their voice, develop foresight ability and to illustrate current futures issues.
profile_positions.title: Emerging Fellow 2023-2025

profile_positions.description: The Millennium Project The Millennium Project is one of the premier participatory think tanks in the global foresight scene. It aims to improve thinking about the future and make that thought leadership available to accumulate knowledge, insights and wisdom about the future for better decisions today. It consists of global foresight network of Nodes that is building a global collective system recognized for its ability to improve prospects for humanity and the planet. It connects futurists around the world and collaborates to improve global foresight.
profile_positions.title: Millennium Project Dutch Node Member

profile_positions.description:
Neol is a Community-powered platform for audacious creative leaders worldwide to do the best work of their lives.

Neol’s platform empowers creative leaders with the technology, people, and processes they need to deliver impactful projects from anywhere at scale. As a Creative Leader at Neol, I am an active member in shaping the Futures & Foresight Pod at Neol.
profile_positions.title: Creative Leader, Neol

profile_positions.description:
The annual One Young World Summit convenes the brightest young talent from every country and sector, working to accelerate social impact. Delegates from 190+ countries are counselled by influential political, business and humanitarian leaders.

Role: Advisory Board Member, part of Bid Committee & Legacy Adviser to the Municipality of The Hague in co-developing and co-facilitating the drafting process of ‘The Hague Youth Declaration on Human Rights in Action’ as the legacy project for One Young World The Hague in collaboration with the organizations Cordaid and Kompas.
profile_positions.title: One Young World The Hague Avisory Board Member, Bid Committee Member & Legacy Adviser

profile_positions.description:
The Lost Faces Foundation (Stichting Verdwaalde Gezichten) strives to encourage societal and political participation among youth as well as adolescents and raises awareness concerning fundamental human rights issues such as self-determination and self-development. The Lost Faces Foundation places a special emphasis on gender equality, empowerment of youth, vulnerables and minorities in societies. The ultimate goal of the foundation is to raise awareness and bring about a change of mentality in society. 

Role: Co-Founder Lost Faces Foundation, Co-Initiator & Developer of the Black Tulip (Zwarte Tulp) Project 

The Black Tulip Project is an educational project that works on discussing honour-related violence, harmful traditions, identity development and the right to self-determination among young people in secondary schools on all levels. The goal is to raise awareness around these issues and to try to bring about a change of mentality among youth. Black Tulip has been nationally implemented under the support of the Dutch Minister of Education, Culture & Science & the Minister of Housing, Communities & Integration and received several (inter)national awards. 

In 2008 the Black Tulip project has been recognized as a good practise by the Ministry of Education, Culture & Science as one of the 163 exemplary projects that have been supported by the ministry so far. The ministry defined Black Tulip as an accessible and creative pedagogy and methodology designed and developed by an engaged organisation. 

- Includes Educational Documentary Verdwaalde Gezichten (Lost Faces) 
- Television Documentary Eerwraak (Honour Killings in cooperation with Yeter Akin & Frans Bromet)
profile_positions.title: Co-founder

company.name: The University of Notre Dame Australia

profile_positions.location: University of Notre Dame, Utrecht University, Varna University of Management
profile_positions.company: The University of Notre Dame Australia
profile_positions.description:
Conducted award-winning (Emerald & HETL Outstanding Doctoral Research Award) and cutting-edge research on Millennial Leadership in 117 countries worldwide. This study has a focus on the role of leaders within the Millennial Generation in social and sustainable change processes and examined related value-orientations and dominant worldviews in leadership and organizational paradigm. This study generated new quantitative and qualitative data (in 117 countries) and knowledge around Millennials through a global Ph.D. program that I created at the University of Notre Dame Australia, Sydney Campus (Faculty of Arts & Sciences), Utrecht University (Faculty of Geosciences) and Varna University of Management (Organizational Behaviour & Cross Cultural Studies) with the support of the eminent Professor emeritus Geert Hofstede and in collaboration with a multi-stakeholder partnership with the Kantar TNS, a global leader in market research, the Millennial Research Team, Synergized Earth Network (SEN) and the support of various youth leadership networks worldwide. The incubation of the research has been conducted at the University of Sydney (M.Phil, Department of Gender and Cultural Studies & Centre for Peace and Conflict Studies (CPACS) with the support of the Huygens Scholarship Program by Nuffic.

Research Field: 
Complexity Science, Leadership Development & Organizational Studies, Future of Work in the Digital Age, Paradigm Shifts, Organisational Behaviour & Change, Millennials, Sociology of Global Youth, Personal Development, Talent Management, Lifelong Learning, Sustainable Development, Social Change, Ethics, Diversity, (Social) Entrepreneurship, Innovation, International Relations, Global Governance & Action-Baseds Research.

Research Background:
Liberal Arts & Sciences education with a major in Sociology & Anthropology and a specific interest in leadership development, organisational design, societal change and sustainable development with an interdisciplinary approach.
profile_positions.title: Ph.D. (Doctor of Philosophy)

profile_positions.description:
As a delegate and organizer in Global Leadership Programmes in 6 continents and 28 countries I participated in experiential learning opportunities intersecting theory and practise. I focussed on the world's most pressing complex global challenges on a social, economic and ecological level with human dignity and development as a centred theme. By an interdisciplinary and systems approach through various segments of human societies—encompassing the politics of world hunger, North-South relations, the environmental crisis and intergroup conflicts (East-West dichotomies, minority, gender and indigenous issues) in relation to social change and sustainable development processes, human rights, restorative justice, leadership development & organizational change, conflict resolution and peace-building I participated in integral crash courses to understand various geographies worldwide on a deeper level. Consequently, I worked on a grassroots level for Community-Based-Organizations and NGOs in the respective countries and generated engaged knowledge that was informed by the contextual social policy mechanisms within the field. 

These learning experiences inspired my personal leadership development to shape a larger vision. Together with peers as emerging leaders and impact agents within the Millennial generation and mutual mentors as existing (seasoned) leaders sector-wide, I strive to contribute to the paradigm shifts of our time in the way we lead, learn, collaborate, do business and design organizations to tackle the most pressing challenges across generations, sectors and disciplines. In this way, I strive to bring together a cohesive intergenerational value-driven world community. Hereby the focus is on individuals who centre their personal leadership development for committed action in their direct personal and professional communities to work towards synergized collaboration for a more just, thriving and sustainable world in the 21st century.
profile_positions.title: Global Leadership Programmes

profile_positions.description: In a social policy development role I consulted, advised and evaluated on recent research, monitored given subsidies on projects, answered questions send by the members of the parliament, reviewed leadership, management and organizational structures and prepared debates taking place within the Dutch Parliament.
profile_positions.title: Ministry of Housing, Spatial Planning & the Environment, Directorate Neighbourhoods & Communities
